pullrequest.title: Process insertions and deletions on gz log echo - fix issue #2136

content.raw:
hi @chapulina I have tried this PR to see if it addresses #!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2136/gz-log-echo-renders-state-log-unplayable.

I can confirm that the robot model is inserted now and the log file plays correctly.

However, there is a URDF-related error that appears, because of [the changes to WorldState.cc](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/ad1cbdef2401#Lgazebo/physics/WorldState.ccT173). [This error](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ad1cbdef2401f5e56f9746e60ecfbaea4a7fe8a2/gazebo/physics/World.cc?at=issue_2136&fileviewer=file-view-default#World.cc-2100) is raised, with some SDF errors:

```
Error [parser_urdf.cc:3423] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:340] parse as old deprecated model file failed.
[Err] [World.cc:2100] Unable to read sdf string[<model name='robot'>
  <link name='linear_arm_actuator'>
    <pose frame=''>0.3 0 0.9 0 -0 0</pose>
    <inertial>
      <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
      <mass>1</mass>
      <inertia>
        <ixx>0.1</ixx>
        <ixy>0</ixy>
        <ixz>0</ixz>
        <iyy>0.1</iyy>
        <iyz>0</iyz>
        <izz>0.1</izz>
      </inertia>
    </inertial>
    <collision name='linear_arm_actuator_collision'>
      <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
      <geometry>
        <box>
          <size>0.2 4.6 0.1</size>
        </box>
      </geometry>
      <surface>
        <contact>
          <ode/>
        </contact>
        <friction>
...
```


If I revert the change to that file, the error goes away.

The model that I am inserting is being inserted with the `spawn_model` ROS node from `gazebo_ros_pkgs` which I believe uses a factory. This is probably not how you inserted the model for the test case (though I'm not sure where the difference comes into play)

Note that the error does not affect the *playing* of the log file, so if necessary I can just ignore it. But it would be nice to avoid this error if possible.


Thank you for the work so far, it is already a great improvement thanks!
content.html:
hi @chapulina I have tried this PR to see if it addresses #!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2136/gz-log-echo-renders-state-log-unplayable.

I can confirm that the robot model is inserted now and the log file plays correctly.

However, there is a URDF-related error that appears, because of the changes to WorldState.cc. This error is raised, with some SDF errors:

Error [parser_urdf.cc:3423] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:340] parse as old deprecated model file failed.
[Err] [World.cc:2100] Unable to read sdf string[<model name='robot'>
  <link name='linear_arm_actuator'>
    <pose frame=''>0.3 0 0.9 0 -0 0</pose>
    <inertial>
      <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
      <mass>1</mass>
      <inertia>
        <ixx>0.1</ixx>
        <ixy>0</ixy>
        <ixz>0</ixz>
        <iyy>0.1</iyy>
        <iyz>0</iyz>
        <izz>0.1</izz>
      </inertia>
    </inertial>
    <collision name='linear_arm_actuator_collision'>
      <pose frame=''>0 0 0 0 -0 0</pose>
      <geometry>
        <box>
          <size>0.2 4.6 0.1</size>
        </box>
      </geometry>
      <surface>
        <contact>
          <ode/>
        </contact>
        <friction>
...

If I revert the change to that file, the error goes away.

The model that I am inserting is being inserted with the spawn_model ROS node from gazebo_ros_pkgs which I believe uses a factory. This is probably not how you inserted the model for the test case (though I'm not sure where the difference comes into play)

Note that the error does not affect the playing of the log file, so if necessary I can just ignore it. But it would be nice to avoid this error if possible.

Thank you for the work so far, it is already a great improvement thanks!

pullrequest.title: Process insertions and deletions on gz log echo - fix issue #2136

content.raw: I think sdf failed to parse the insertion sdf elem because `sdf::readString` expects the `<sdf version='x.x'>` element to be present. I briefly tested wrapping the insertion element with `<sdf>` and the error message disappeared but unfortunately now the model appears to be added twice during playback.
content.html: I think sdf failed to parse the insertion sdf elem because sdf::readString expects the <sdf version='x.x'> element to be present. I briefly tested wrapping the insertion element with <sdf> and the error message disappeared but unfortunately now the model appears to be added twice during playback.

pullrequest.title: Process insertions and deletions on gz log echo - fix issue #2136

content.raw: Thanks for the lead, I found the problem. Insertions are being processed in two separate places. I'm working on a fix.
content.html: Thanks for the lead, I found the problem. Insertions are being processed in two separate places. I'm working on a fix.

pullrequest.title: Process insertions and deletions on gz log echo - fix issue #2136

content.raw:
Fixed on e406af0. Now:

* Model insertion is processed without warnings or duplications
* Light insertion and deletion are also processed. 
    * Requires [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/325/support-light-insertion-in-state/diff) sdformat pull request.
    * Test has been adapted to handle that as well
* The `WorldState::insertions` vector keeps model or light SDF descriptions in string format without being wrapped in an `<sdf>` tag
    * Some expectations on `INTEGRATION_physics::StateInsertion` have been adapted to handle that
* Also made sure there are `<name>` tags inside `<deletions>`
content.html:
Fixed on e406af0. Now:

  • Model insertion is processed without warnings or duplications
  • Light insertion and deletion are also processed.
    • Requires this sdformat pull request.
    • Test has been adapted to handle that as well
  • The WorldState::insertions vector keeps model or light SDF descriptions in string format without being wrapped in an <sdf> tag
    • Some expectations on INTEGRATION_physics::StateInsertion have been adapted to handle that
  • Also made sure there are <name> tags inside <deletions>

pullrequest.title: Process insertions and deletions on gz log echo - fix issue #2136

content.raw: There was a sneaky deadlock between the `TopicManager` and the `World`. If you're curious, here's the [backtrace](https://bitbucket.org/snippets/chapulina/Eb9rb). I think I fixed it by processing the log playback control messages in the physics thread: 5f5afea
content.html: There was a sneaky deadlock between the TopicManager and the World. If you're curious, here's the backtrace. I think I fixed it by processing the log playback control messages in the physics thread: 5f5afea

pullrequest.title: Process insertions and deletions on gz log echo - fix issue #2136

content.raw:
I ran into another issue which I'm looking into right now:

1. Start Gazebo not recording a log
1. Insert a double pendulum
1. Start recording log
1. Stop log, close Gazebo
1. Playback: there will be 2 pendulums, one doesn't move

This is happening because the pendulum is being included both on the world description and in an insert tag.
content.html:
I ran into another issue which I'm looking into right now:

  1. Start Gazebo not recording a log
  2. Insert a double pendulum
  3. Start recording log
  4. Stop log, close Gazebo
  5. Playback: there will be 2 pendulums, one doesn't move

This is happening because the pendulum is being included both on the world description and in an insert tag.

pullrequest.title: Process insertions and deletions on gz log echo - fix issue #2136

content.raw:
Commit 11c0c9b adds support for both cases, but I'm not a fan of it since when the `<sdf>` tag is missing, SDF prints misleading error messages when nothing wrong happened:

~~~
Error [parser_urdf.cc:3474] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:341] parse as old deprecated model file failed.
~~~

This is coming from the `sdf::readString` function. I'm not sure if this is the recommended way of checking whether an SDF string is valid or not. Also see [this](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issues/151/trying-to-parse-an-invalid-file-gives-urdf) SDFormat issue.

If there isn't a better way to check for valid SDF, I was thinking of just using TinyXML. Thoughts?
content.html:
Commit 11c0c9b adds support for both cases, but I'm not a fan of it since when the <sdf> tag is missing, SDF prints misleading error messages when nothing wrong happened:

Error [parser_urdf.cc:3474] Unable to call parseURDF on robot model
Error [parser.cc:341] parse as old deprecated model file failed.

This is coming from the sdf::readString function. I'm not sure if this is the recommended way of checking whether an SDF string is valid or not. Also see this SDFormat issue.

If there isn't a better way to check for valid SDF, I was thinking of just using TinyXML. Thoughts?
